abstract: Republican presidential campaigns and outside groups have begun running political ads focused on terrorism, Paris attacks and threat by groups like Islamic State; ads both darken Christmas season and walk fine line between highlighting candidates' security credentials and capitalizing on tragedy.
lead_paragraph: Candidates and outside groups are starting to feel comfortable running ads about the attacks, navigating a delicate line in politicizing a tragedy.

headline.main: Paris Attacks Darken Tone of G.O.P. Campaign Ads
headline.print_headline: Paris Attacks Darken Tone of G.O.P. Campaign Ads

snippet: Candidates and outside groups are starting to feel comfortable running ads about the attacks, navigating a delicate line in politicizing a tragedy.

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
